h1_38: Texas A&M College of Medicine-Scott and White Medical Center (Temple) Program
h3_39: Texas A&M College of Medicine-Scott and White Medical Center
p_64: Dashes ("-") indicate data for a particular field are not provided for this program in Residency Explorer. Reasons why data are not being provided can vary (e.g., they are not reported or available, they are not applicable, or they are based on an insufficient number of people for reporting purposes).
h3_68: # of Filled Resident Positions, by Year*
p_79: *Totals may vary from year to year due to off-cycle residents.
th_97: # of Residents Who Were Graduates of a Joint MD-PhD program
p_100: Our program focuses on training residents in diagnosis and management of skin cancers. Residents enjoy hands on surgical training during residency. Faculty are engaged and 80% of conferences are faculty led. Residents and faculty enjoy an environment of mutual respect and supportive teaching. Generous stipends are provided for presentations at national meetings. Our board exam pass rate is 100%. Graduates pursue a mixture of private practice, academic dermatology and fellowship training.
